p: There were 29 unique samples; 4 reports were generated from a single sample. Sample sizes ranged from 7 to 735 participants, and 10 studies had sample sizes larger than 100. The reports represented a total of 3,594 participants. Three reports did not specify the total number of male and female participants in the sample. Among the rest, 59% of the sample was female ( n = 1,956) and 41% was male ( n = 1,368). Research took place in rural areas ( n = 16), cities ( n = 9), or multiple sites that included both urban and rural residents ( n = 4). Twelve samples were from Kenya, six were from Tanzania, and 11 from Uganda.
